title: Openscapes Reflections
text:
Adapted from The Turing Way

title: Openscapes Reflections
text: This is a 3-week program, modeled after leadership coaching, that provides structure and accountability for participants to reflect and plan. This reflection and planning focuses on analytical and reporting workflows, and how open data science tools, practices, and communities can improve daily habits and fuel institutional culture change.

title: Reflections: You and your workflow
text:
You - What are things you know about yourself (I write best in the mornings, I am comfortable speaking up in new spaces)? What is something you learned recently? What is something you learned about yourself recently? Think about something you enjoy doing. What do you enjoy about it? What qualities about yourself do you see coming through? What are your values? Where do you go to get help?






Your turn



 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 



Workflow - Jot down thoughts about your workflow. What feels good, what feels clunky? Are there things you find yourself repeating a lot (copy-pasting, clicking?) What does a typical day or week look like? What software do you use, and for what purposes? How do you connect pieces together (saving screenshots to send via email?) How do you document your process; how do you come back to something after a week, a month, a year? How do you interact with colleagues? Who do you share your workflow with? Who would you like to share this with? Push back against the "I work alone" response: who do you talk to, who influences your work, how do you give and receive feedback

title: Imagine: Future You
text: What have you seen or heard about that has you curious? What is something you’d like to learn? What’s blocking you (time, supervisor support, knowing where to start?) What’s something you’ve meant to look up but haven’t had the chance? Do your values show up in your workflow, and how you interact with colleagues? Getting help - google, youtube, twitter. Colleagues remote and local, on campus. Communities exist. How to interpret search results. Tools and stories

title: Goal-setting: Future Us
text: What goals do you have, and what do you need to accomplish those goals? What barriers do you see, what questions do you need answered, what conversations do you need to have? Who are your allies, your sponsors, your mentors? Who gives you energy and support? What is something that gives you agency
